intro: Phaca uspallatensis, commonly known as the Uspallata phaca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
